DOC.brief_summary: Study compare metabolic electrolyte effect single oral dose 320 mg ritobegron administer alone pre- comedication bisoprolol , propranolol acipimox . In addition , compare metabolic electrolyte effect single dose 320 mg ritobegron single inhalatory dose 100 Î¼g salmeterol
DOC.brief_title: In Vivo Specificity KUC 7483 CL Co-administered With Bisoprolol , Propranolol , Acipimox Healthy Male Subjects
DOC.criteria: Healthy male Age > = 30 < = 60 year Body Mass Index ( BMI ) > = 18.5 < = 29.9 kg/m2 Signed date write informed consent accordance Good Clinical Practice local legislation Any finding medical examination ( include blood pressure , pulse rate ECG ) deviate normal clinical relevance Gastrointestinal , hepatic , renal , respiratory , cardiovascular , metabolic , immunological hormonal disorder , clinically relevant electrolyte disturbance Diseases central nervous system ( epilepsy ) psychiatric disorder neurological disorder History orthostatic hypotension , faint spell blackouts Chronic clinically relevant acute infection History allergy/hypersensitivity ( include drug allergy ) deem relevant trial judge investigator Intake drug long halflife ( > 24:00 hour ) within least one month less ten halflives respective drug enrolment study study Use drug might influence result trial 7 day prior enrolment study study Participation another trial investigational drug ( within two month prior administration trial ) Smoker ( > 10 cigarette > 3 cigar > 3 pipes/day ) Inability refrain smoke trial day Alcohol abuse ( > 60 g/day ) Drug abuse Blood donation ( > 100 mL within four week prior administration trial ) Any laboratory value outside reference range indicative underlying disease poor health Excessive physical activity within last week trial trial Hypersensitivity treatment medication , salmeterol and/or relate drug class Congenital document acquire QT prolongation , previous history symptomatic arrhythmia Systolic BP < 115 mmHg Heart rate rest > 80 bpm < 55 bpm Any screen ECG value outside reference range clinical relevance include , limited PR interval > 220 m , QRS interval > 115 m , QTcB > 420 m , QT ( uncorrected ) > 450 ms History asthma obstructive pulmonary disease . Psoriasis ( medical history relative )
